Legal_Issue: Whether the respondent demonstrated 'special circumstances' excusing nonuse of the trademark 'PROMODE' under s. 45 of the Trade Marks Act
Procedural_Stage: Appeal under s. 56 of the Trade Marks Act
Evidence_Assessment: Delays due to organizational challenges, industry cycles, key personnel resignations, and deliberate business planning were considered as evidence
Burden_of_Proof: On respondent to show special circumstances for nonuse
Credibility_Factor: Senior Hearing Officer found the respondent's explanation credible
Legal_Rule: Under s. 45, nonuse of a trademark may lead to expungement unless excused by special circumstances
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness standard applied to the Senior Hearing Officer's decision
Procedural_Issue: No new evidence presented on appeal
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Process followed correctly; no procedural unfairness identified
Key_Evidence_Considered: Organizational delays, industry conditions, personnel changes, business strategy
Legal_Framework: Trade Marks Act framework for trademark maintenance and expungement
Applicant_Challenge: Appellants challenged the Registrar's decision not to expunge the mark
Legal_Rule_Source: Section 45 of the Trade Marks Act
Defendant_Response: Respondent provided justification based on special circumstances
Evidence_Type: Documentary and explanatory evidence regarding business operations
Decision_Authority: Senior Hearing Officer and appellate authority under s. 56
Remedy_Sought: Cancellation of trademark registration due to nonuse
Legal_Provision: s. 45 and s. 56 of the Trade Marks Act
Authority: Registrar of Trademarks and Senior Hearing Officer
Governing_Rule: s. 45 â€“ Special circumstances exception to trademark use requirement
